candidates.title: Is This a Photo of Georgia Gov. Kemp and His Mother in KKK Garb?
candidates.content:
Claim:
A photograph shows Georgia Gov. Brian Kemp and his mother dressed in KKK garb.
Rating:
Miscaptioned
About this rating
An image circulated on social media shows a young boy and a woman dressed in Klu Klux Klan (KKK) robes and hoods, with a caption identifying the pictured persons as now-Gov. Brian Kemp of Georgia and his mother:
No evidence suggests this is actually a picture of the Georgia governor or his mother. The photograph is part of the Bettmann Archive, available through the visual media company Getty Images with a caption noting that the identities of the pictured persons are unknown:
More important, Getty Images lists the creation date for this photograph as April 27, 1956. As Brian Kemp was born in 1963, it is not temporally possible that he could be the young boy seen here.
candidates.description: Sometimes possibilities are ruled out through simple chronology.

result.explanation: This assessment is evidence-based. The Snopes article provides strong evidence that the caption is inaccurate and misrepresents a historical photograph.  The image does depict individuals in KKK garb, but there is no evidence that the individuals are Gov. Brian Kemp and his mother. The photo's date predates Kemp's birth. The Snopes article explicitly rates the claim as "Miscaptioned."
supporting_evidence: Source 1: Snopes.com fact-check: https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/brian-kemp-mother-kkk/ This article debunks the claim that the photo depicts Gov. Kemp and his mother, citing the photo's date (1956) as predating Kemp's birth and the lack of evidence confirming the identities of the individuals in the image.

Source 1 states: "No evidence suggests this is actually a picture of the Georgia governor or his mother. The photograph is part of the Bettmann Archive, available through the visual media company Getty Images with a caption noting that the identities of the pictured persons are unknown."
